title:
Electron impact partial ionization cross section and thermal rate
  coefficients of gaseous refrigerants
abstract:
We have calculated the electron impact partial and total ionization cross
sections of important gaseous targets, such as Trifluoromethane (CHF$_3$),
1,1,1,2-Tetrafluoroethane $(\mathrm{C_2H_2F_4})$ or R134a,
1,1,1-Trifluoroethane $(\mathrm{C_2H_3F_3})$ or R143a, 1,1,1-Trifluoropropane
$(\mathrm{C_3H_5F_3})$ or R263fb, and 3,3,3-Trifluoropropene
$(\mathrm{C_3H_3F_3})$ or R1243zf using the binary encounter Bethe model and
its variants. The corresponding rate coefficients are calculated for total and
partial ionization cross sections using the Maxwell's velocity distribution
function. Our data for partial and total ionization along with the rate
coefficient showed good agreement with the existing data in the literature. The
targets studied are important for plasma applications and are used in gas-based
detectors at high-energy physics experiments.
